verses.roman:
yaḥ sapta-hāyano bālaḥ
kareṇaikena līlayā
kathaṁ bibhrad giri-varaṁ
puṣkaraṁ gaja-rāḍ iva

synonyms: yaḥ—who; sapta-hāyanaḥ—seven years of age; bālaḥ—a boy; kareṇa—with a hand; ekena—one; līlayā—playfully; katham—how; bibhrat—He held up; giri-varam—the best of mountains, Govardhana; puṣkaram—a lotus flower; gaja-rāṭ—a mighty elephant; iva—as.
translation: How could this seven-year-old boy playfully hold up the great hill Govardhana with one hand, just as a mighty elephant holds up a lotus flower?
